course.title: Advanced Scientific Computing: Stochastic Optimization Methods
course.faculty_text: Verena S. Kaynig-Fittkau and Pavlos Protopapas
course.description: Develops skills for computational research with focus on stochastic approaches, emphasizing implementation and examples. Stochastic methods make it feasible to tackle very diverse problems when the solution space is too large to explore systematically, or when microscopic rules are known, but not the macroscopic behavior of a complex system. Methods will be illustrated with examples from a wide variety of fields, ranging from simulating the immune system to strategies for investing in financial markets.
course.prerequisites: Basic knowledge of a computer programming language (such as C or/and Python).
